db:abstract.db:para: MapPinchEvent type provides basic information about pinch event.
This type was introduced in Qt Location 5.0.

db:listitem.db:para: MapPinchEvent is part of QML Maps Plugin

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: MapPinchEvent type provides basic information about pinch event. They are present in handlers of MapPinch (for example pinchStarted/pinchUpdated). Events are only guaranteed to be valid for the duration of the handler.
Except for the accepted property, all properties are read-only.

db:section.db:title: Example Usage
db:section.db:para: The following example enables the pinch gesture on a map and reacts to the finished event.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] point1 : QPoint
db:section.db:para: These read-only properties hold the actual touch points generating the pinch. The points are not in any particular order.

db:section.db:title: accepted : bool
db:section.db:para: Setting this property to false in the MapPinch::onPinchStarted handler will result in no further pinch events being generated, and the gesture ignored.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] angle : real
db:section.db:para: This read-only property holds the current angle between the two points in the range -180 to 180. Positive values for the angles mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean the clockwise direction. Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] center : QPoint
db:section.db:para: This read-only property holds the current center point.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] pointCount : int
db:section.db:para: This read-only property holds the number of points currently touched. The MapPinch will not react until two touch points have initiated a gesture, but will remain active until all touch points have been released.
